**Primary Purpose**: Console text colorization module for Pygments syntax highlighter. Provides ANSI escape code utilities for colored terminal output.

**Key Constants and Data Structures**:
- `esc` (L11): Base ANSI escape sequence "\x1b["
- `codes` (L13-37): Master dictionary mapping color/style names to ANSI escape codes
  - Basic styles: reset, bold, faint, standout, underline, blink, overline
  - Dark colors (L24-25): black, red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, gray → codes 30-37
  - Light colors (L26-27): bright variants → codes 90-97 (60+base)
  - Special mapping: "white" aliases to "bold" (L37)

**Core Functions**:
- `reset_color()` (L40-41): Returns reset escape sequence to clear all formatting
- `colorize(color_key, text)` (L44-45): Wraps text with specified color and auto-reset
- `ansiformat(attr, text)` (L48-70): Advanced formatter supporting attribute combinations:
  - `+color+`: blinking (L58-60)
  - `*color*`: bold (L61-63) 
  - `_color_`: underlined (L64-66)
  - Attributes can be stacked and are applied in order

**Architecture Notes**:
- Uses procedural initialization loop (L29-35) to populate color codes efficiently
- Cleanup of temporary variables (L35) maintains namespace hygiene
- Color codes follow standard ANSI terminal specification (30-37 for dark, 90-97 for bright)
- All formatting functions automatically append reset codes to prevent style bleeding

**Dependencies**: Pure Python, no external imports. Designed for UNIX-style terminal environments supporting ANSI escape sequences.
